definition[0]: a top-down way of organizing a business is one in which the most important people make decisions and tell the people below them what they should do
example[0]: The company has a top-down management system.
definition[1]: a top-down way of understanding or explaining something starts with a general idea and adds details later
definition[2]: a top-down plan etc is one in which you start with a general idea of what you want and then add the details later
example[2]: Centralised systems of education are organised on a system of top-down management.
